==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|てん|が}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=てんが}} compound {{m|zh|天鵞|tr=then nga||swan|lit=heavenly + goose}}. The second character {{m|zh|鵞}} has apparently been [[supersede]]d in modern {{etyl|zh|-}} by the alternative form {{m|zh|鵝}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} {{m|zh|天鵝|tr=tin<sup>1</sup> ngo<sup>4</sup>}}.

This word appears in the 1734 work {{lang|ja|本朝世事綺談}} (''Honchō Seji Kidan'', “Embellished Tales of Everyday Japan”; also listed as {{lang|ja|本朝世事談綺}}, with the last two characters swapped), in a description of the kanji spelling of {{m|ja|天鵞絨|tr=tengajū</i>, alternative reading <i>birōdo||velvet|pos=archaic, largely replaced by the borrowed term {{m|ja|ビロード|tr=birōdo}}}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|てんが}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|てんが}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=てんが|rare|obsolete}} a [[swan]]

====Usage notes====
This term has been replaced in modern Japanese by {{m|ja|白鳥|tr=hakuchō||swan|lit=white bird}}.
